programme.title: African Voices Changemakers: Ebuka Obi-Uchendu
programme.desc: Ebuka Obi-Uchendu sits down with Larry Madowo to share how he went from a shy law graduate to the celebrated host of Big Brother Naija. We explore his bold fashion collaborations with designer Mai Atafo and the cultural stories behind his iconic style, plus a rare look at his home life, his advocacy for young boys and his growing influence.(n)

programme.title: Marketplace Africa: Driving and Digitizing Nigeria's Blue Economy; Samer Kassem
programme.desc: Despite poor road infrastructure, massive traffic congestion, water transportation across the abundant waterways of Lagos, Nigeria is still underutilized. Now, renewed push to develop the region's waterways has seen a growth in passenger ferrires as well as a partnership with the international boat racing franchise E1. E1 is also looking to grow their presence on the continent through digital education and outreach. We take a look at the challenges and opportunities of tapping into the region...(n)

programme.title: Tech for Good: Tech for Good 604
programme.desc: The power of technology to build a better world - incredible people beating the odds to follow their dreams, and the remarkable new technologies enabling them and others to thrive.(n)

programme.desc: Inside Africa takes its viewers on a journey across Africa, exploring the true diversity and depth of different cultures, countries and regions.(n)

programme.title: Forged In Fire (S10)
programme.desc: Four smiths get cooking when they are tasked with forging a chef's knife. After a round of testing performed by a professional chef, only two head back to their home forge to build a brutal hog splitter.(n)

programme.title: Hidden Cities (S1)

programme.title: Lost U-Boats Of WWII

programme.title: The Art Of Washoku

programme.title: How Disney Built America

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.(n)

programme.title: Outside In: Lost in Academia
programme.desc: Japanese culture is in the global spotlight like never before. Dive into the work of international scholars exploring Japan in bold, original ways, uncovering unique perspectives and deep insights.(n)

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.(n)

programme.title: Today's Close-Up
programme.desc: Dig deeper into current affairs. Cutting-edge information and critical analysis on important issues confronting Japanese lives.(n)

programme.title: NEWSROOM TOKYO
programme.desc: NEWSROOM TOKYO dives deeper into the day's news with insight and analysis, from the perspective of Japan and the rest of Asia. We put a spotlight on what you need to know to understand the issues.(n)

programme.title: Direct Talk #240
programme.desc: Matsuo Takahiro has gained international recognition for installations that fuse light with cutting-edge technology. He talks about how he creates his one-of-a-kind light art.(n)

programme.title: JAPAN DELISH 5min.
programme.desc: Japanese festival favorite, yakisoba! Noodles cooked in a special sauce. Enjoy local yakisoba from all over Japan!(n)

programme.title: National Parks of Japan
programme.desc: Towada-Hachimantai National Park comprises the nature-rich Oirase-Keiryu, the crystal-clear Lake Towada, and the lush marshlands of Mt. Hachimantai. It presents nature in its many forms.(n)

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
programme.desc: Japan is a seismically active land; the Edo period was no exception. In the aftermath of a major 1855 earthquake, an angry guardian deity set off on a quest to capture those considered responsible.(n)

programme.title: Hometown Stories
programme.desc: In 1985, a passenger jet crashed into Osutaka Ridge, killing 520 people. Kurosawa Kanichi looks after the area, preserving memorials and guiding bereaved family members up the mountain.(n)

programme.title: Satoyama Kitchen Fall
programme.desc: At the Satoyama Kitchen guesthouse in Hida Takayama, chef Nobuko, her cameraman husband Makoto and their cat Tama take us on a tasty journey of local cuisine served with a side of seasonal scenery.(n)

programme.title: Japanology Plus
programme.desc: In the late 19th century, writer Lafcadio Hearn (Japanese name: Koizumi Yakumo) helped introduce Japan to the wider world. We visit the Izumo area to learn about the supernatural realm that he loved.(n)

programme.desc: A week into the new year, giant torches are lit in a shrine precinct. The shadows they create enable a demon-oni-to go to a river and cleanse people of troubles. This is Oniyo: the night of the oni.(n)

programme.title: Chatroom Japan
programme.desc: Kang Sang-mi, a third-generation Korean born and raised in Japan, embraced her Korean name and heritage after struggling with her identity. She now empowers kids with foreign roots.(n)

programme.title: IMPACTS: Climates Change the World
programme.desc: Food waste is a major driver of global warming. One institute warns that greenhouse gas emissions from food waste exceed those of nations like India and Russia. We examine the data behind this issue.(n)

programme.title: DESIGN MUSEUM JAPAN
programme.desc: Morinaga Kunihiko (Fashion designer)visits Amami Oshima, Kagoshima. Priestesses on Amami wore patchwork robes with triangular butterfly designs, intended to protect the wearer from unseen spirits.(n)

programme.title: Time-lapse Japan
programme.desc: The Murakami Kaizoku were seafarers and fighters in the Seto Inland Sea. We explore their history and legacy, with footage from time-lapse creator Shimizu Daisuke. This time, Nii Oshima Island.(n)

programme.title: BOSAI: Science that Can Save Your Life
programme.desc: The sun's tremendous energy provides various benefits, but also poses some significant risks. In this episode, we will explore the mysteries of solar flares, and their threat to human activities.(n)

programme.desc: Culture Crossroads comprises several regular programs with the theme of creating a multicultural society. They look at international exchange programs and give tips on disaster preparedness.(n)
